Key Arguments: The diversity of thought in Australia is valuable and should be preserved.
Individuals should have the freedom to choose what they read and write on the internet.
Education and discernment are personal responsibilities, not governmental ones.
ACMA is not qualified to determine the accuracy of information published by experts.
Exposure to differing opinions is necessary for understanding differences.
Notable Quotes: It is our God given right to educate ourselves.
Forget new ACMA powers to combat misinformation and disinformation and let us AUSTRALIANS carry on deciding what we read/not read, write/not write, enjoy or ignore on the internet.
